intro: Erasanthe henrici, commonly known as the Henrici's erasanthe, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers. The plant typically features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of red, pink, or white. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
